channel.title: Explore Desktop Guide on Mentalab Wiki
channel.description: Recent content in Explore Desktop Guide on Mentalab Wiki

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Installation Download the Explore Desktop installer. Download the Explore Desktop installer. For Ubuntu users, right-click on the installer, select ‘Permissions’ and check ‘Allow executing file as program’. Double click on the installer to launch and follow the on-screen instructions. Once installed, Explore Desktop will reside in the Explore Desktop folder in the installation directory. It will also show in the Start Menu (Windows), Launchpad (MacOS), and Applications Menu (Ubuntu).

item.title: Usage
item.description: Connect Under normal usage, Explore Dekstop will open to the Connect page. Use this page to connect to your Mentalab Explore device, or to import recorded data. Scan and connect to a Mentalab Explore device. There are two ways to connect to your Mentalab Explore device. Either scan for nearby devices and select your device, or write the name of your device in the input line. In either case, ensure that your device is in advertising mode.

item.title: Visualization
item.description: Visualize ExG, orientation and spectral analysis data in real-time by navigating to the Visualization page. You can configure the visualization via the drop-down menus at the top of the Visualization page or by selecting ‘Filters’. Use the settings at the top of Visualization page to configure your visualization. Settings include: Signal – EEG or ECG mode. EEG provides the spectral analysis plot of the signal. ECG mode detects heartbeats and calculates heart rate from the RR-intervals.

item.title: Recording
item.description: Configure your recording using the pop-up. Record data in real time to EDF (BDF+) or CSV by selecting ‘Record’ on the Visualization page. A pop-up will allow you to configure your recording. Settings include: File format – select the output file type (EDF or CSV): CSV mode generates an extra file for the marker events EDF mode records data in BDF+ format (in 24-bit resolution) Folder and name prefix – select where to store files and the file prefix.

item.title: Impedance
item.description: To measure the impedances of your Mentalab Explore electrodes, navigate to the Impedance Measurement page. Select which type of electrodes you are using from the drop-down menu. Then, click on ‘Measure Impedances’. Channel impedances will display their value and corresponding color code as in the table below.   Color Range (kΩ) Wet electrodes Dry electrodes Green Yellow 10 – 20 20 – 35 Orange 20 – 30 35 – 50 Red 30 – 50 50 – 70 Black 50 7 Gray Inactive channel / Device not connected / Impedance too high (250 kHz for wet electrodes) Impedance values depend on the impedance of the reference electrode.

item.title: Lab Streaming Layer
item.description: You can push data to LSL by navigating to the Integration page and selecting ‘Push’. To stop streaming to LSL, select ‘Stop’. If your device loses connection, Explore Desktop will try to reconnect automatically. When pushing to LSL, you will generate three LSL data streams. One for ExG data, motion data, and event markers. Using LSL, you can stream data from other data providers, like OpenVibe, MATLAB, Java, and C++. See the Integrations section for more.

item.title: Troubleshooting
item.description: Unstable Bluetooth connection Possible causes are: An HDMI cable connected to a second display can make the connection unstable. If the computer is connected to other Bluetooth devices that have a high data transfer rate, like a headset, connections can become unstable. The device is at the limit of its range. No device found with name Ensure your device is on and in advertising mode (blinking blue once a second).
